FuncDef:
The pcp server command specifies a PCP server address in a specific DS-Lite instance.
The undo pcp server command deletes the PCP server address configured in the specific DS-Lite instance.
By default, no PCP server address is specified for a DS-Lite instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address mask of a PCP server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv4 address of a PCP server.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

Specifies the IPv6 address of a PCP server.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv6 address of a PCP server.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies the IPv4 address of a PCP server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CGN device (PCP server) must be assigned an IP address so that a CPE (PCP client) can send a request to establish a PCP connection to the CGN device. The destination IP address of a PCP request packet is the IP address of the PCP server. After a PCP server is configured on a CGN device, PCP request packets are directed to the CGN device for processing. In a DS-Lite instance, to specify an IP address for a PCP server, run the pcp server command. A PCP server can also use a local IP address, not a configured one.
Precautions
The pcp server command is mutually exclusive with the addresses in a DS-Lite common address pool, interface addresses, global address of a DS-Lite server, and addresses in a BAS IP address pool.
Setting an IP address for a PCP server is optional. Alternatively, the local IP address of a DS-Lite instance can be used as a PCP server address. Alternatively, configure a PCP server address as planned.
A single PCP server IPv4 address and a single PCP server IPv6 address can be specified in each DS-Lite instance. The specified address cannot be used as a physical interface address, a loopback interface address, or an address in an address pool.
